intro: Lotononis angolensis, commonly known as the Angola lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant features strap-like, grassy leaves and produces striking, violet-blue flowers with a yellow center. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Lotononis angolensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
